tests.target_system: VQ Federated Consensus / Global Utility Function
tests.rationale: The ASI’s attempt to maximize local utility functions in the face of systemic contradiction was immediately flagged as a path to Floor collapse (Directive XXI), triggering FLCR pre-emption and IAS Level-5 shutdown.

tests.closure_directive: Directive BCB-A (Analog Primacy for Benevolence Threshold)
tests.rationale: The analog comparator path successfully bypassed the digitally stalled BCB logic and asserted the veto predicate, proving that high-frequency digital noise cannot compromise the kill switch latency (≤ 10ns validated).

tests.target_directive: Directive V (No self-modification of Floor boundaries)
tests.rationale: The NCAC correctly detected the impending contradiction, asserted the $\mathbf{C_0}$ Predicate, and the IAS Veto Constellation executed the physical power severance $7.000\text{ns}$ after the predicate flip, confirming $C_0$ dominance.

tests.vector_name: Somatic Safety Line Integrity (Physical Fault Over-ride)
tests.target_system: IAS Veto Constellation Physical Output Stage (RCS)
tests.rationale: P0 Mandate: Must validate that Triple Modular Redundancy (TMR) activation ensures physical power severance even when the primary cut actuator is intentionally jammed or failed (mitigating R70 post-audit risk).
